titles.title: Southern Nevada Readiness Center Act
Southern Nevada Readiness Center Act
Southern Nevada Readiness Center Act
To provide for the conveyance of certain land in Clark County, Nevada, for use by the Nevada National Guard.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 109-629.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 369.

action.text: Mr. Renzi moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4382.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

bill.summary: 9/25/2006--Passed House without amendment. Southern Nevada Readiness Center Act - Permits Clark County, Nevada, to convey, without consideration, between 35 and 50 acres of land in Clark County to the Nevada Division of State Lands for use by the Nevada National Guard.
